content.text:
# Draft:Swami avimukteshwaranand saraswati ji maharaj

Swami Avimukteshwarananda Saraswati is a Hindu religious leader and the current Shankaracharya of Jyotirmath (also known as Jyotir Math or Jyotir Mutt) in Uttarakhand, India. He was appointed to this position following the death of Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati in September 2022. Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati has also been involved in student politics and various religious movements, particularly in Varanasi.
Key points about Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati:
Successor to Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati:
He became the Shankaracharya of Jyotirmath after the passing of his guru, Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati, who also held the same position at Dwarka Sharada Peetham.
Jyotirmath Shankaracharya:
He is the 46th Shankaracharya of Jyotirmath.
Early Life and Education:
He was born in 1969 in Pratapgarh, Uttar Pradesh, and his original name was Umashankar Pandey. He received his education in Varanasi, including Shastri and Acharya degrees from Sampurnanand Sanskrit University.
Student Politics and Religious Activism:
He was actively involved in student politics during his university days and has led several religious movements in Varanasi.
Involved in Ganga Protection:
He has been a vocal advocate for the protection of the Ganga river and has participated in protests against its pollution.
Controversies:
His appointment as Shankaracharya was disputed by some, leading to legal challenges and court interventions.
Other Activities:
He has also been involved in campaigns for cow protection and has opposed the construction of the Kashi Vishwanath Corridor in Varanasi.
